title: How to Run Command Prompt As an Administrator on Windows

steps.headline: Press ⊞ Win+S.
steps.description: This opens the Windows search bar.

steps.headline: Type cmd.
steps.description: A list of results will appear.

steps.headline: Right-click Command Prompt.
steps.description: It’s the option with a black terminal window icon.

steps.headline: Click Run as administrator.
steps.description: This opens a page called Administrator: Command Prompt. You can now run any command you wish.

text: Press ⊞ Win+S. This opens the Windows search bar. Type cmd. A list of results will appear. Right-click Command Prompt. It’s the option with a black terminal window icon. Click Run as administrator. This opens a page called Administrator: Command Prompt. You can now run any command you wish.
sentences: This opens the Windows search bar.
A list of results will appear.
It’s the option with a black terminal window icon.
This opens a page called Administrator: Command Prompt.
You can now run any command you wish.
